job description:
Research
Scientist in Sample Prep Lab

Metabolon, headquartered in Research Triangle Park, NC, is
the world's leading life sciences company focused on metabolomics - an
integrative, powerful phenotyping technology for assessing health. Its
proprietary platforms and informatics are delivering biomarker discoveries,
innovative diagnostic tests, breakthroughs in personalized medicine, and robust
partnerships in genomics-based health initiatives. Due
to our rapidly growing services business, Metabolon is seeking a Research
Scientist to be an integral member of our platform team. The team member in this position will report
to the Group Leader, Platform Chemistry and will be responsible for the preparation
of samples prior to analysis on our mass spectrometry platform. This position will be on a five day per week
work schedule with the possibility of a required weekend commitment. The
successful candidate will have experience in sample preparation for LC and/or
LC-MS.

Responsibilities
  • Handling
    the physical samples as they are received and processed for the mass
    spectrometry platform.
  • Independently
    perform sample measurements, including pipetting and weighing of
    biological samples.
  • Operate
    lab robotics and equipment during chemical extraction of biological
    samples.
  • Perform
    biological assays on samples and prepare reports for the Project Director
    and others as needed.
  • Perform
    liquid/liquid extractions on biological samples.
  • Perform
    or assist in accessioning of incoming client samples.
  • Maintain
    consumables inventories.
  • Maintain
    laboratory equipment and report problems to the Sample Prep Manager.
  • Prepare
    Sample Prep worksheets in LIMS.
  • Write
    experimental protocols, analyze data and summarize reports.
  • Contribute
    to scientific papers and posters.
Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a life science is required. The preferred candidate will also have a
    minimum of 3 years’ experience in the field or in a related area.
  • Must be familiar with a variety of the field's concepts,
    practices, and procedures. Experience
    with chromatography and liquid-handling robotics are desired.
  • Some knowledge of organic chemistry, biological systems and
    laboratory automation.
  • A broad overview of chemistry, including chemical structures
    and nomenclature, and familiarity with general concepts, practices and
    procedures is expected.
  • Ability to work independently or in a team environment is required.
  • Ability to plan experiments and carry out data analysis.
  • Computer skills should include MS Office (Excel, Word,
    Powerpoint, Outlook, etc.)
  • Some experience working in LIMS systems is desired.
  • The team member is expected to use experience and good
    judgment to accomplish tasks in a satisfactory manner.
